labels.what_is_api: What is API / How to get?

descs.normal_model: Used for complex logic, story generation, etc.
descs.fast_model: Used for simple judgments, frequent interactions, etc.
descs.max_concurrent_requests: Number of concurrent requests to AI. Higher value increases speed but may trigger API Rate Limit. Recommended: 5-20.

placeholders.api_key: Enter your API Key here (usually starts with sk-)

modes.normal_desc: Use intelligent model for all tasks
modes.fast_desc: Use fast model for all tasks

help.title: What is API? Configuration Guide
help.q1_content: API (Application Programming Interface) is like a 'phone line'. This game itself doesn't have thinking capabilities; it connects to a remote AI 'brain' (like Qwen or DeepSeek servers) through this line. When the game settles monthly and decides NPC actions, it sends relevant information through the API to the AI, which thinks and returns the result.
help.q2_qwen: Major domestic player (Alibaba), stable with large free quotas, good for beginners.
help.q2_deepseek: Extremely high cost-performance, logic fits Chinese context well.
help.q2_gemini: Produced by Google, top-tier comprehensive performance.
help.q3_content: Once you have an API, you need to fill in these three core parameters. Usually, you can find them in the provider's documentation:
help.q3_format_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: This game only supports OpenAI-compatible API format. Services that don't support OpenAI-compatible format cannot be used. We recommend using the presets (they are all confirmed compatible). If you want to use other services, please confirm they provide OpenAI-compatible interfaces.
help.q3_base_url: API Base URL: The entry point to AI, usually provided by the vendor (e.g., https://api.deepseek.com).
help.q3_api_key: API Key: Your identity credential, like an account password.
help.q3_model_name: Model Name: Tell the server which 'brain' to use, e.g., deepseek-chat or gemini-3-flash-preview.
help.q5_p1: Your API Key is only saved in your local computer's configuration file (`static/local_config.yml`), and the locally running game backend communicates directly with the model vendor. This game (Cultivation World Simulator) is completely open-source and will never upload your Key to any third-party server. Also, please do not share your local_config.yml file with anyone.
help.q5_p2: Token usage incurs costs; please evaluate the cost of use yourself.
